intro: Babiana patersoniae, commonly known as the pink babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers. The plant produces showy, tubular blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Babiana patersoniae is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
